texts.content_text1:
Ana's Case study:
Ensuring Communication and Understanding
texts.content_text2:
Ana cannot understand the authorities and struggles to express herself.

As a lawyer of Ana, you…
texts.content_text100: Ask another child to help interpret informally.
texts.content_text101: Request free interpretation and translation services, as well as communication support adapted to her speech impediment.
texts.content_text102: Continue proceedings using simplified language only.
texts.content_text103: Delay all action until she learns the language.
texts.content_text_feedback:
Why?
Ana has a right to interpretation and translation.
Proceedings must be understandable to her.
Communication support ensures effective participation.
Informal interpretation (e.g., another child) would violate procedural safeguards and confidentiality.
